question: Irulan. A Third Stage Guild Navigator will be here within minutes!
answer: We felt his presence.

question: I shall want telepathy during his visit and a report when we're finished.
answer: Their minds are so.... They move in strange directions....

question: Yes?
answer: Forced spice evolution of humans changes many things.... I must sit close to him.

question: He will not permit anyone but me to see him. You must be outside this room.... Do what you can.
answer: I am your Truthsayer, my lord... He is here, my lord.

question: Leave us.
answer: Yes, my Lord.

question: We are alone...
answer: We have just folded space from Ix...

question: Yes?... How was your journey?
answer: Many machines on Ix... new machines.

question: Oh yes?
answer: Better than those on Richesse.. You are transparent... I see many things... I see plans within plans.

question: Is there a problem?... Usually there is a problem when one of you makes a visit.
answer: The answer is within the problem... I see two Great Houses -- House Atreides, House Harkonnen -- feuding... I see you behind it.

question: Yes.
answer: You must share with us.

question: The Atreides house is building a secret army!... using a technique unknown to us... a technique involving sound. The Duke is becoming more popular in the Landsraad... he could threaten me.... I have ordered House Atreides to occupy Arrakis to mine the spice... thus replacing their enemies the Harkonnens.... House Atreides will not refuse because of the tremendous power they think they will gain. Then, at an appointed time Baron Harkonnen will return to Arrakis and launch a sneak attack on House Atreides... I have promised the Baron five legions of my Sardaukar terror troops.
answer: So the Harkonnens will rid you of House Atreides...

question: Yes.
answer: Reverend Mother... I will give you the Tleilaxu Path.

question: Here we are now... nineteen light years beyond... ... beyond Epsilon Alangue... is Arrakis. It does look dry.... Where are the Harkonnens from here? There!... Geidi Prime and the Baron Harkonnen... the enemy. I know, Thufir, I'm sitting with my back to the door. I heard you, Dr. Yueh and Gurney coming down the hall.
answer: Those sounds could be imitated.

question: I'd know the difference.
answer: Yes. Perhaps he would at that.

question: My father sent you to test me. Music then?
answer: No music. I'm packing this for the crossing. Shield practice.

question: Shield practice? Gurney... we had practice -- this morning..... I'm not in the mood.
answer: Not in the mood?! Mood's a thing for cattle and love play... not fighting.

question: I'm sorry Gurney.
answer: Not sorry enough. Guard yourself for true!

question: What's gotten into Gurney? He's not faking. Paul presses forward and the fight moves quickly around the room. The smell of ozone grows stronger as the shields hit and SPARK off one another. Paul directs a parry downwards, turns, and leads Gurney against the table, plunging at just the right moment to pin Gurney against the table top with his blade right at Gurney's neck. Is this what you seek?
answer: Good... the slow blade penetrates the shield... but look down. We'd have joined each other in death. However, you did seem to finally get the "mood".

question: Would you really have drawn my blood?
answer: If you'd fought one whit below your abilities I'd have scratched you a good one.

question: Things have been so serious here lately.
answer: Yes. I sensed the play in you lad, but this can no longer be play. Tomorrow we leave for Arrakis! Arrakis is real. The Harkonnens are real.

question: Dr. Yueh, do you have any information on the worms of Arrakis?
answer: I have obtained a filmbook on a small specimen... only 125 meters long.

question: Only?!
answer: There are have been documented sightings of worms as large as 450 meters in the deep desert -- far from where we'll be in Arakeen.... The desert belt and the south polar regions are marked forbidden.... Why?

question: The storms and the worms. Is it true, that the sand can blow at seven hundred kilometers per hour?
answer: It can render flesh to dust in minutes. And these dry winds can generate tremendous static electricity in the atmosphere. Our body shields won't have enough power to operate in the open air on Arrakis.

question: Well, how do the Fremen survive there?
answer: We don't know much about the Fremen... They live in the deep desert... some of them in the cities and they have blue- within-blue eyes...

question: The eyes -- yes, yes... saturation of the blood by the spice -- melange. Could the spice affect us in other ways?
answer: Many dangers exist on Arrakis. For one, we know the Harkonnens would not have given up their CHOAM company contract so easily.

question: The Harkonnens are our enemies, yes... but behind them, I suspect, is the Emperor.
answer: You will make a formidable Duke! Now remember... the first step in avoiding a trap is knowing of its existence.

question: I know. But if it is a trap then why are we going?
answer: We have our new army. Dr. Yueh, put the weirding module on him. Clear and lock the room. Activate a fighter.

question: The bull that killed my grandfather... is this an evil omen? Duncan! Why? I wish you were coming with us. May the hand of God be with us all, Duncan. Father.
answer: Thank you for joining me, Paul. It will be good to get to our new home and have all this upset behind us. My son. Thufir Hawat has served House Atreides three generations.... He swears you are the finest student he's ever taught. Yueh, Gurney and Duncan say the same.... It makes me feel very proud...

question: I want you to be proud of me.
answer: I'll miss the sea... but a person needs new experiences... they jar something deep inside, allowing him to grow. Without change, something sleeps inside us... and seldom awakens... The sleeper must awaken.

question: Jessica... You were told to bear only daughters to the Atreides... Jessica!
answer: It meant so much to him...

question: You thought only of a Duke's desire for a son?... Desires don't figure in this! An Atreides daughter could have been wed to a Harkonnen heir and sealed the breach. We may lose both blood lines now.
answer: I vowed never to regret my decision. I'll pay for my own mistakes.

question: And your son will pay with you.
answer: Paul, this is the Reverend Mother Gaius Helen Mohiam. She is going to... observe you... Please...

question: Jessica, you know it must be done. I enjoin you to stand guard at the door and practice the meditation of peace.
answer: Your Reverence.

question: Now you come here.
answer: She's using The Voice. No.

question: Some strength there. Surprising! Come here. See this... Put your right hand in the box.
answer: What's in the box?

question: Pain. STOP! Put your hand in the box.
answer: The Voice again.

question: I hold at your neck the gom jabbar. Don't pull away or you'll feel that poison. A Duke's son must know about many poisons -- this one kills only animals.
answer: Are you suggesting a Duke's son is an animal?

question: Let us say I suggest you may be human. Your awareness may be powerful enough to control your instincts. Your instincts will be to remove your hand from the box. If you do so you will die. You will feel an itching -- there... see? Now the itching becomes burning... heat, upon heat, upon heat.
answer: It burns. I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear... I will permit it to pass over me and through me.

question: You feel the flesh crisping? Flesh dropping off.
answer: THE PAIN!

question: NO!! ENOUGH!! Kull wahad! No woman child ever withstood that much. I must have wanted you to fail. Take your hand out of the box and look at it, young human.... Do it! Pain by nerve induction... A human can resist any pain. Our test is crisis and observation.
answer: I see the truth of it.

question: Could he be the one?... Maybe... but will he be ours to control? You know when people speak the truth?
answer: I know it.

question: Your mother wants you to tell me about your dreams. I only want to know one thing.... Do they come true?
answer: Not all of them... I know which ones will.

question: Perhaps you are the Kwisatz Haderach.
answer: What is it?

question: The person who can be many places at once... the one who bridges space and time.... He will look where we cannot.
answer: Where?

question: Do you know of the Water of Life?... the Truthsayer drug?
answer: I have heard of it.

question: It is very dangerous... very painful. The Bene Gesserit sisterhood drink it to see within.... There is a place terrifying to us... to women. It is said a man will come... the Kwisatz Haderach... he will go where we cannot... Many men have tried...
answer: Did they try and fail?

question: They tried and died.... Jessica! I sense your teachings in him. Ignore the regular order of training. His safety requires The Voice.
answer: I've heard enough of my safety... What about my father?... I heard you talking. You speak as if he was dead. Well, he isn't!

question: It is by will alone I set my mind in motion. It is by the juice of Sapho that thoughts acquire speed - The lips acquire stains - The stains become a warning - It is by will alone I set my mind in motion. My Lord!
answer: Piter.

question: The Atreides will be leaving Caladan soon, Baron, and I have here your answer from Duke Leto.
answer: What does Leto say, Piter?

question: He wishes to inform you that Vendetta -- as he puts it, using the ancient tongue, the art of Kanly -- is still alive. He does not wish to meet or speak with you.
answer: I made my peace gesture... the forms of Kanly have been obeyed.

question: As you instructed me, I have enlightened your nephews concerning my plan t...
answer: My plan!

question: The plan to crush the Atreides. Feyd, Rabban... go quietly... no other great house of the Landsraad must ever know of the Emperor's aid to the Baron. The entire Landsraad would turn against the Baron and the Emperor.
answer: You're so beautiful my Baron Your skin, love to me Your diseases lovingly cared for For all eternity. I will have Arrakis back for myself... he who controls the Spice, controls the universe... and what Piter didn't tell you is we have control of someone who is very close to Duke Leto. This person... this traitor... will be worth more to us than ten legions of Sardaukar.

question: Listen here.... You can here the people of Arrakeen outside.... Can you here the cry "Soo Soo Sook" of the water sellers?
answer: So many reminders of the scarcity of water.

question: Have you noticed the line of palms along the wall... the Harkonnen put them in... to flaunt their water wealth in front of these people.... Each day those palms take enough water to sustain the life of one hundred men.
answer: The way you say Harkonnen... I didn't know you had so much reason to hate them.

question: My wife... you didn't know my wife... they...
answer: Forgive me... ... His wife was Bene Gesserit too... the signs are al over him.... They must have killed here.

question: I'm sorry I'm unable to talk about it. The Harkonnens may have tampered medically.... please wait.
answer: He's hiding something -- holding something back. It's not just his wife... He's a good man though. He's probably trying to save my feelings... I could use The Voice... make him tell me... It would only shame him. I must place more trust in my friends.

question: I must speak with you Leto! Yes? You may refer to me as "my lady." I am not noble born. I'm the bound concubine of Duke Leto -- mother of the heir designate.... "Shadout"... that's an ancient word.
answer: You know the ancient tongues?

question: I know the Bhotani Jib and Chakobsa, all the hunting languages.
answer: As the legend says.

question: That's it! The Missionaria Protectiva has been here planting protective legends against a day of Bene Gesserit need. And that day has come. I must play out this sham. I know the Dark things and the way of the Great Mother. Miseces prejin. I know many things. I know you came prepared for violence with a weapon in your bodice.
answer: My lady, I... the weapon was sent as a gift if you should prove to be the one.

question: And the means of my death should I prove otherwise. Now we will see which way the decision tips.
answer: Do you know this my lady?

question: It could only be one thing.... It's a crysknife.
answer: Say it not lightly... Do you know its meaning?

question: Here is why this Fremen has taken service with me, to ask that one question. Delay is as dangerous as the wrong answer. Shadout is Chakobsa... knife, in Chakobsa is... maker of death. It's a maker... Maker?... Maker is the key word... the tooth of the worm? That was close... Did you think that I, knowing the mysteries of the Great Mother, would not know the maker?
answer: My lady, when one has lived with prophecy for so long, the moment of revelation is a shock.

question: There's more here... yes! Mapes, you've sheathed that blade unblooded.
answer: Take the water of my life! You are ours.... You are the one.

question: With your permission... You've worn a stillsuit before?
answer: No.

question: Your suit is fitted desert fashion. Who told you how to do that?
answer: No one. It... seemed the proper way.

question: Southeast over the Shield Wall. That's where I told your sandmaster to concentrate his harvesting.
answer: Will we see a worm?

question: Where there is spice and spice mining there are always worms.
answer: Always?

question: Always.
answer: Why do they come?

question: To protect their territory. Vibrations attract them.
answer: I've registered him now... a knife is a sheath on his left arm... He's strong... a person born to command... He's hiding many things. Is there a relationship between the worms and the spice?

question: Spotter control -- give me a report by the numbers.
answer: Damn it... Harkonnens. We are coming down to take you off the harvester... All spotters are ordered to comply.

question: Ordered by whom?
answer: Duke Leto Atreides....

question: Yes... yes, Sire!
answer: How many men do you have?

question: Full crew -- twenty-six men -- but Sire, we can't leave this spice...
answer: Damn the spice! Get out of there. Two men in each of the spotters... You!... over here... run!!

question: What happened? What? The shield! Yueh! He's sabotaged the house generators, we're wide open.
answer: I've brought House Atreides down. I've destroyed the new army's weirding modules.

question: ... Why?
answer: I wish to kill a man... not you, my dear Duke, but the Baron.... You were dead already... but you will be close to the Baron before you die. You will be tied and drugged but you can still attack. When you see the Baron you will have a new poison tooth. He will want you close so he can gloat over you. One bite on this tooth and a strong exile...

question: Refuse...
answer: No! -- You mustn't... for in return I will save the lives of your Paul and Jessica. For Paul... When you see the Baron, remember the tooth! The tooth!

question: Duke Leto Atreides. Someone's torn the insignia off your uniform. Such carelessness.
answer: It was Feyd.

question: It was Feyd? It was Feyd! Where is the ducal signet ring? I must have his ring.
answer: The ring?... he was brought to us as is, Baron. I...

question: Wait... he must be near...
answer: Where is your ring? You do not answer!

question: A... little... closer.... The... water... of my life... for Paul.
answer: He's crying! He's crying! He's crying, Piter. What does he mean?

question: I can't maintain any altitude... we'll never reach the safety of rock. Maybe that small rock.
answer: Where are we do you think?

question: The South Polar regions... the forbidden area. We must make it to that rock... Hurry!
answer: Bring these satchels!

question: Hurry -- This crashing may bring a worm.
answer: A million deaths are not enough for Yueh...

question: Listen to me!... you wanted to know about my dreams... and I've just had a waking dream... do you know why?...
answer: Calm yourself/

question: The spice! It's in everything here. The air, the soil, the food... It's like the Truthsayer drug..... It's a poison!!!! You knew the spice would change me. But thanks to your teachings it's changed my consciousness. I can see it... I can see it.
answer: Is he....?

question: You carry my unborn sister in your womb!
answer: He knows.

question: Yueh's left the plans for the weirding modules. We have to get to that mountain of rock. We have entered the time when all will turn against us and seek our lives... It's further than I thought... a worm is sure to come.... I'll plant a thumper, that should divert it.
answer: ...the night is a tunnel... a hole into tomorrow... if we're to have a tomorrow...

question: Remember... walk without rhythm and we won't attract a worm... it'll go to the thumper.
answer: I'm ready.

question: Keep going... Faster!!
answer: It's deafening!

question: Run!
answer: I can't... I can't.

question: Drum sand! Cinnamon... the spice! Do you smell it?
answer: Yes...

question: I know the secret. The worm is the spice... the spice is the worm.
answer: Paul!

question: A thumper.
answer: What's happened?... Why did it leave?

question: Someone started another thumper.... We're not alone.
answer: Man-carved steps.

question: You have strength... real strength... You shall be known as Usul, which is the strength of the base of the pillar. This is your secret name in our troop. But you must choose the name of manhood which we will call you openly.
answer: What do you call the mouse shadow in the second moon?

question: We call that one Muad'dib.
answer: Could I be known as Paul Muad'dib?

question: Feyd, even though he's aging, Thufir is one of the finest Mentats in the Universe... and he's mine, Feyd... all mine.... Quiet now.
answer: I will.

question: Oh Thufir, I see they've installed your heart plug already.... Don't be angry. Everyone gets one here. But this is not why we're here. We've brought you a little cat, Thufir. You must care for it if you wish to live. A poison has been introduced into you, Thufir Hawat. By milking this smooth little cat body each day you receive your antidote... it must be done each day.... Also, you must do something for me if you wish to live. You know I lost Piter, my dear Mentat...
answer: All I can see is an Atreides that I want to kill.
